intro: Calycolpus sessiliflorus, commonly known as the sessile-flower calycolpus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and showy, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually sessile, meaning they lack a stalk, and are arranged in dense inflorescences. Calycolpus sessiliflorus is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to tolerate saline conditions.
